Intervention: The usual care is the comparison of clinical patients, where there is no change in their standard or usual care.
Patients: Participants will answer questions on the tablet to calculate their breast cancer risk.

Once the patient has completed the breast care computer survey, the program will immediately produce a personal feedback report containing information on her risk factors and recommendations to reduce her risk. This report will be printed and provided to patients prior to meeting with her physician.
* BreastCARE: The doctor will receive a medical report containing information similar to the patient's report.
Eligibility: Women who visit the practices of General Internal Medicine (GIM) at SFGH and UCSF during the study period
● Self-identify as Asian, Spanish-speaking and English-speaking Latinas, African-Americans or Whites
No history of breast cancer is admissible.
physicist component: front-line physicians are currently practicing in FGH and UCSF GIM clinics
Patient component: Women whose doctors oppose their participation in the study
physicist component: No exclusion criteria for physicians
Results: Knowledge of breast cancer risk factors
The results were measured through a survey. Knowledge of breast cancer risk was based on a series of eight questions in the survey.
Time limit: one week after the initial visit (approximately one week)
Description of the arm/group: The usual care is the comparison of patients in the clinic, where there is no change in their standard or usual care.
Unit of measurement: units on a scale 48.9 (24.3)
Title of the arm/group: BreastCARE intervention
Description arm/group: Intervention Clinic Patients: Participants will answer questions on the tablet to calculate their breast cancer risk.

Once the patient has completed the breast care computer survey, the program will immediately produce a personal feedback report containing information on her risk factors and recommendations to reduce her risk. This report will be printed and provided to patients prior to meeting with her physician.
* BreastCARE: The doctor will receive a medical report containing information similar to the patient's report.
Unit of measurement: units on a scale 56.4 (24.3)
